case_circumstances: This middle-aged African American female checked in to a local motel on 06/27/11 and arrived there by taxi. She paid for a room in cash through 07/11/11. It was later found that she had stayed at other local motels in the area, always taking a taxi, paying in cash, and giving false and different names. She told the Motel 9 that her name was Sandra Nelson, of 5203 Bosa Ave., Park City, UT. This was later found to be a non-existent address and false name. She also stated that she was originally from Los Angeles and was looking for a house in this area. On 07/11/11, she did not show up for breakfast as had been her custom. Since it was her last paid day, staff assumed she had checked out. They entered her room with a master key and found her deceased on the bed with pills at her feet and a bright blue, granular purging coming from her nose and mouth. There was no suicide note but autopsy results showed a massive overdose of multiple medications and case was ruled as a suicide. Luggage and other items were found in the room but all identifiers had been meticulously eliminated before death. All attempts to identify the decedent have failed.
case_head_hair: Gray/ black, with more white in front around face; styled into soft waves, but tight, afro curls when wet at autopsy
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is available and entered
case_clothing_on_body: Brown/ black/white  Paisley design pullover top, black undershirt; black bra; black pants; white cotton panties; white socks
case_clothing_with_body: 2 suitcases w/ miscellaneous clothing and toiletries
case_jewelry: White metal earrings; white metal chain necklace; white metal wristwatch
case_other_items_with_body: Walking cane; unmarked baggies of pills/ medications; black purse w/ wallet but no personal information; Bible; book "The Political Teachings of Jesus"
dental: Dental information / charting is currently not available
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
